title: Bump @sentry/browser from 8.50.0 to 9.40.0 in /frontend

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

labels.name: javascript
labels.description: Pull requests that update Javascript code

body:
Bumps [@sentry/browser](https://github.com/getsentry/sentry-javascript) from 8.50.0 to 9.40.0.
Release notes

Sourced from @​sentry/browser's releases.

9.40.0

Important Changes

  • feat(browser): Add debugId sync APIs between web worker and main thread (#16981)

This release adds two Browser SDK APIs to let the main thread know about debugIds of worker files:

  • webWorkerIntegration({worker}) to be used in the main thread
  • registerWebWorker({self}) to be used in the web worker
// main.js
Sentry.init({...})

const worker = new MyWorker(...);


Sentry.addIntegration(Sentry.webWorkerIntegration({ worker }));


worker.addEventListener('message', e => {...});



// worker.js
Sentry.registerWebWorker({ self });

self.postMessage(...);
  • feat(core): Deprecate logger in favor of debug (#17040)

The internal SDK logger export from @sentry/core has been deprecated in favor of the debug export. debug only exposes log, warn, and error methods but is otherwise identical to logger. Note that this deprecation does not affect the logger export from other packages (like @sentry/browser or @sentry/node) which is used for Sentry Logging.

import { logger, debug } from '@sentry/core';

// before

logger.info('This is an info message');


// after

debug.log('This is an info message');

  • feat(node): Add OpenAI integration (#17022)

This release adds official support for instrumenting OpenAI SDK calls in with Sentry tracing, following OpenTelemetry semantic conventions for Generative AI. It instruments:

  • client.chat.completions.create() - For chat-based completions
  • client.responses.create() - For the responses API

title: Bump github.com/go-git/go-git/v5 from 5.13.1 to 5.16.2

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

labels.name: go
labels.description: Pull requests that update Go code

body:
Bumps [github.com/go-git/go-git/v5](https://github.com/go-git/go-git) from 5.13.1 to 5.16.2.
Release notes

Sourced from github.com/go-git/go-git/v5's releases.

v5.16.2

What's Changed

  • utils: fix diff so subpaths work for sparse checkouts, fixes 1455 to releases/v5.x by @​kane8n in go-git/go-git#1567

Full Changelog: https://github.com/go-git/go-git/compare/v5.16.1...v5.16.2

v5.16.1

What's Changed

  • utils: merkletrie, Fix diff on sparse-checkout index. Fixes #1406 to releases/v5.x by @​kane8n in go-git/go-git#1561

New Contributors

  • @​kane8n made their first contribution in go-git/go-git#1561

Full Changelog: https://github.com/go-git/go-git/compare/v5.16.0...v5.16.1

v5.16.0

What's Changed

  • [v5] plumbing: support mTLS for HTTPS protocol by @​hiddeco in go-git/go-git#1510
  • v5: plumbing: transport, Reintroduce SetHostKeyCallback. Fix #1514 by @​pjbgf in go-git/go-git#1515

Full Changelog: https://github.com/go-git/go-git/compare/v5.15.0...v5.16.0

v5.15.0

What's Changed

  • plumbing: add cert auth support to releases/v5.x by @​Javier-varez in go-git/go-git#1482
  • v5: Bump dependencies by @​pjbgf in go-git/go-git#1505

Full Changelog: https://github.com/go-git/go-git/compare/v5.14.0...v5.15.0

v5.14.0

What's Changed

  • v5: Bump Go and dependencies to mitigate GO-2025-3487 by @​pjbgf in go-git/go-git#1436

:warning: Note that this version requires Go 1.23, due to the bump to golang.org/x/crypto@v0.35.0 which mitigates the CVE above. User's that can't bump to Go 1.23 will need to remain on the previous v5.13.x release.

Full Changelog: https://github.com/go-git/go-git/compare/v5.13.2...v5.14.0

v5.13.2

What's Changed

  • plumbing: use the correct user agent string. Fixes #883 by @​uragirii in go-git/go-git#1364
  • build: bump golang.org/x/sys from 0.28.0 to 0.29.0 in the golang-org group by @​dependabot in go-git/go-git#1365
  • build: bump the golang-org group with 2 updates by @​dependabot in go-git/go-git#1367
  • build: bump github.com/ProtonMail/go-crypto from 1.1.3 to 1.1.4 by @​dependabot in go-git/go-git#1368
  • build: bump github.com/go-git/go-billy/v5 from 5.6.1 to 5.6.2 by @​dependabot in go-git/go-git#1378
  • build: bump github/codeql-action from 3.28.0 to 3.28.1 by @​dependabot in go-git/go-git#1376
  • build: bump github.com/elazarl/goproxy from 1.2.3 to 1.4.0 by @​dependabot in go-git/go-git#1377
  • git: worktree, fix restoring dot slash files (backported to v5). Fixes #1176 by @​BeChris in go-git/go-git#1361

... (truncated)

Release notes

Sourced from torch's releases.

PyTorch 2.6.0 Release

  • Highlights
  • Tracked Regressions
  • Backwards Incompatible Change
  • Deprecations
  • New Features
  • Improvements
  • Bug fixes
  • Performance
  • Documentation
  • Developers

Highlights

We are excited to announce the release of PyTorch® 2.6 (release notes)! This release features multiple improvements for PT2: torch.compile can now be used with Python 3.13; new performance-related knob torch.compiler.set_stance; several AOTInductor enhancements. Besides the PT2 improvements, another highlight is FP16 support on X86 CPUs.

NOTE: Starting with this release we are not going to publish on Conda, please see [Announcement] Deprecating PyTorch’s official Anaconda channel for the details.

For this release the experimental Linux binaries shipped with CUDA 12.6.3 (as well as Linux Aarch64, Linux ROCm 6.2.4, and Linux XPU binaries) are built with CXX11_ABI=1 and are using the Manylinux 2.28 build platform. If you build PyTorch extensions with custom C++ or CUDA extensions, please update these builds to use CXX_ABI=1 as well and report any issues you are seeing. For the next PyTorch 2.7 release we plan to switch all Linux builds to Manylinux 2.28 and CXX11_ABI=1, please see [RFC] PyTorch next wheel build platform: manylinux-2.28 for the details and discussion.

Also in this release as an important security improvement measure we have changed the default value for weights_only parameter of torch.load. This is a backward compatibility-breaking change, please see this forum post for more details.

This release is composed of 3892 commits from 520 contributors since PyTorch 2.5. We want to sincerely thank our dedicated community for your contributions. As always, we encourage you to try these out and report any issues as we improve PyTorch. More information about how to get started with the PyTorch 2-series can be found at our Getting Started page.

title: provider issues
body:
when configuring Together AI as an inference provider through the Providers tab in the dashboard when I have a default provider configured as VLLM. Inference on the home page now fails with 404s because Together AI isn’t the default inference provider, but the list of models is being fetched from Together AI 

Also: Editing a provider and saving it seems to make it forget the API key

title: frontend niggles
body:
This is one issue to keep track of everything I've slurped in from Slack

 - [x] giving write access to an app doesn’t actually allow it to get edited
 - [x] the “edit” shortcut button on the app page (new session for app) doesn’t show up when user has edit/admin access to app (but they can still edit it via “your apps” page)
 - [x] a different model picker bug, where switching to "image" on the homepage no longer auto-switches to FLUX, is hurting users
 - [ ] sourcemaps
 - [x] frontend hanging and crashy
 - [x] xhr request loop
 - [x] homepage revamp
 - [x] app dropdown
 - [x] app list
 - [x] image models
 - [ ] add documents link
 - [ ] reload whilst inference
 - [ ] app view crowded on mobile
 - [ ] app editor not responsive
 - [ ] padding has regressed
 - [ ] [Bug with submit chat box jumping between apps/sessions.](https://mlops-community.slack.com/archives/C0675EX9V2Q/p1744278681189849)
 - [x] next interaction keeps state of previous one - done by Luke in https://github.com/helixml/helix/commit/ef238f26c481668fc4ef3fa384972c34526aa63d
 - [x] knowledge disappearing

And then these things are lower priority:

 - [ ] editing knowledge
 - [ ] overlay alignment
 - [ ] image model switching
 - [ ] make buttons be ctrl + clickable
 - [ ] scroll bug
 - [ ] make app page auto-save not click to save
 - [ ] new app spinner
 - [ ] link to learn (add documents)
 - [ ] files button wrong link
 - [ ] copy button on code blocks
 - [ ] comment out image fine tuning tab on "learn" page
 - [ ] remove github integration - we'll recommend GHA [like this](https://github.com/helixml/testing-genai/blob/main/.github/workflows/helix.yml) instead - also clean up references to it in the docs
 - [ ] Update text to link to refer to new add documents button "You can use the toggle at the top to switch to Learn mode:
Customize your own AI by teaching it your own text or images"
 - [ ] Add documents - can't click back
 - [ ] auto switch model when changing to image mode

## homepage revamp

https://github.com/helixml/helix/issues/700

## app dropdown

https://github.com/helixml/helix/issues/795

## app list

 * can we always show the app dropdown, even when there are no apps?
 * can we add to the app dropdown (at the end of the list), "Create new app..." which redirects you to the new app page
 * when switching to an app, we need to keep the app dropdown, the current switch to the breadcrumbs is jarring

## image models

switching to image models no longer updates the model dropdown to show an image model type (you can see this in prod)

## xhr request loop

I'm seeing an infinite loop of XHR requests to /api/v1/apps from the new session page which is making my browser melt. Could this be related to a recent change? If we fail that request, could we backoff rather than hardlooping? (This seems to happen when logged out or in some other error state) (edited) 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/fbcd5851-edca-4f8e-9a46-999ff03842e9)

## overlay alignment

I think the alignment is slightly wrong on the translucent overlay on this screen now?

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/065b02d9-ab1b-420a-ac83-f73ebf81799c)

## image model switching

The model doesn't update when you switch from text to image.
Also if you switch to image, then click flux, then swich back to text and submit, it will submit a chat completion with flux.

## frontend hanging and crashy

frontend is apparently unusably hangy/crashy in latest firefox on mac :confused: could be related to "xhr request loop"

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/53fa73fb-b179-4698-91f8-1d7897d4ff51)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/755d38af-faeb-48b5-8335-b4ef5252d150)

## make buttons be ctrl + clickable

is there a way in react to prevent buttons like this where it's a link under the hood but not an actual <a> element?

it's such a bad UX when you can't cmd click
"home" also has this bug

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c9580311-4b09-4422-a81d-ff6e02f0fd09)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/af90e3e8-169b-468d-a919-06bec9a484aa)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/00f1a9dc-d088-42be-89c2-0a6f11f45464)

## scroll bug

here's an issue with scrolling and rendering:
 * browser scroll disabled but inside the chat there's a scrollbar so if don't put cursor on text the scrollbar is broken
 * if you select text it unselects it, maybe rerendering in a loop?
 * on refresh it's gone so maybe the session never completed?

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/591b83db-eb97-444c-b96c-a5d3023024b1)

## add documents link

could we please add a link from the new chat session page (default app only) to Learn and the link should be called “Add Documents”

## editing knowledge

If I edit anything in the knowledge it becomes something else

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/4b998a07-8fcc-4615-902e-90b88a0a8e15)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/d3c3a262-97c9-45e3-87c0-fcedda10d685)

## make app page auto-save not click to save

We should be saving any edits to an app as they are made without needing to click on a save button and then we can get rid of the save button

The old version of this issue was about knowledge but we upgraded to auto-save:

```
should we start indexing knowledge immediately on upload, rather than waiting for the user to click save? (clicking save might not be obvious. I’m talking about the app editor knowledge tab)

when adding knowledge we need to immediately save the app

but it was sending previous app yaml - instead of the added knowledge
```

## new app spinner

I’ve noticed clicking “new app” on /apps can sometimes be laggy now, since it’s creating a new app before redirecting you, can we add a spinner to the button and make the button unclickable while the request is pending please? otherwise it just seems broken (edited) 

## link to learn (add documents)

i think add the "Add Documents +" button just on the left of the model dropdown (link to learn) 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/67e55fdf-8c4a-497d-ab3c-bdf4c0f76553)

## files button wrong link

another nit, the "files" button in the UI now links to the wrong place, because data entities. is it possible to make it link to any data entity that's attached to the session?

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a3766236-7076-4be1-9ac0-4a63bb667f01)

## comment out image fine tuning tab on "learn" page

image fine tuning doesn't work any more, so disable it in the UI for now

## reload whilst inference

if you refresh the page while an inference is happening it then goes into drumming spinner forever

## app view crowded on mobile

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/29f9cb4f-b2eb-4eac-9dd7-7da039a7348e)

## app editor not responsive

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/29404cfe-b151-4ea3-8a48-1f38b89634f7)

also Burger bar no worky

## padding has regressed

we seem to have lost some padding we had previously

## next interaction keeps state of previous one

when the next interaction starts streaming, it starts out with the same content as the previous one. can we clear it before we show it?

## Add documents - can't click back

when clicking "Add Documents" from the homepage - I can't click "back" on the browser because of the way we are updating the query params

## knowledge disappearing

I've seen knowledge that I added to the app editor disappear, then when i re-added knowledge with the same name, it reappeared with the files I had previously added to it. Can you see any gremlins that could explain this behaviour in the app editor code?

## auto switch model when changing to image mode

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8084002c-ff83-4abe-bbeb-045bb20ccb0d)

Looks like we regressed switching automatically to the Flux model when you switch to image type. also for the very bottom of the list

title: App dropdown
body:
add "create new app" at the bottom of the app dropdown

bring app icons into that list (if they have one) - use the helix icon if they don't have their own icon (the same one as on the list of apps)

on the app icon list - use the app's icon if it has one

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/1fd86536-43f0-4e8f-b4f1-c7f9aa9a1531)

title: Work out why dependabot vite upgrade is breaking
body:
https://github.com/helixml/helix/pull/745

This is a chunky major upgrade - possibly we need to do some caressing of package.jsons to fix this
